name: BROWSER__RUN_BROWSER_AUTOMATION
description: Runs AI-powered browser automation using browser-use with Steel browser session. Can perform complex web tasks, extract data, fill forms, navigate sites, and interact with web elements intelligently.

task.description: Detailed task description for the AI agent including specific steps, expected outcomes, and any data to extract or actions to perform. Be specific about websites to visit, forms to fill, buttons to click, data to collect, and success criteria. Example: 'Navigate to https://example.com, search for 'AI tools', click on the first result, extract the pricing information from the page, and summarize the key features.'

name: BROWSER__SCRAPE_WITH_BROWSER
description: Scrapes website content using advanced crawl4ai library with Steel browser and returns validated structured data. Uses LLM-based extraction with GPT-OSS model and validates output against provided JSON schema. Ensures consistent, type-safe data extraction with automatic validation.

url.description: The complete URL of the website to scrape. Must include protocol (http:// or https://). Example: 'https://example.com/page' or 'https://shop.com/product/123'

extraction_instructions.description: Detailed LLM extraction instructions. Specify exactly what data to extract and how to structure it. Be specific about elements, formatting, and data types. Example: 'Extract product name, price in USD, availability status, and feature list from the product page' or 'Extract all trending repository names, authors, star counts, and descriptions from the GitHub trending page'

output_schema.description: Required JSON schema defining the exact output structure for validation. Must be a valid JSON Schema (Draft 7) with type definitions. Example: {"type": "object", "properties": {"name": {"type": "string"}, "price": {"type": "number"}, "features": {"type": "array", "items": {"type": "string"}}}, "required": ["name", "price"]}

js_script.description: Optional JavaScript code to execute before extraction. Useful for interacting with dynamic content, triggering events, or manipulating the page structure before scraping. Example: 'document.getElementById("load-more").click();' or 'window.scrollTo(0, document.body.scrollHeight);'

js_delay_seconds.description: Optional delay in seconds to wait after executing JavaScript before starting extraction. Useful for waiting for page changes or dynamic content to load after JavaScript execution. Default is 0 (no delay). Maximum allowed is 600 seconds.

name: BROWSER__RUN_JS_AND_RETURN_RESULT
description: Executes JavaScript code in a browser environment and returns the result. Can save the JSON result as an artifact file or return it directly. Useful for dynamic content extraction, DOM manipulation, and custom data processing that requires JavaScript execution.

url.description: The URL to navigate to for establishing browser context and cookies before executing JavaScript. Must include protocol (http:// or https://). Example: 'https://example.com'

js_code.description: The JavaScript code to execute in the browser. This code MUST return a value that will be captured and returned. Can access DOM elements, manipulate page content, or perform any valid JavaScript operations. Example: 'return document.querySelector("h1").textContent;' or 'return Array.from(document.querySelectorAll(".price")).map(el => el.textContent);'

output_filename.description: Optional filename to save the JSON result as an artifact. If provided, the result will be saved as a downloadable file instead of being returned directly. The '.json' extension will be added automatically if not present. Example: 'page_data' or 'extracted_content.json'

delay_seconds.description: Optional delay in seconds to wait after page load before executing JavaScript. Useful for dynamic content that needs time to load or initialize. Default is 0 (no delay). Maximum allowed is 600 seconds.

name: BROWSER__TAKE_SCREENSHOT
description: Takes a screenshot of a webpage and saves it as an artifact. Useful for visual documentation, debugging, or capturing the current state of a web page.

url.description: The complete URL of the webpage to screenshot. Must include protocol (http:// or https://). Example: 'https://example.com'

output_filename.description: The desired filename for the screenshot artifact. The '.png' extension will be added automatically if not present. Example: 'page_screenshot' or 'homepage.png'

full_page.description: Whether to capture the full page height or just the viewport. Default is false (viewport only).

delay_seconds.description: Optional delay in seconds to wait after page load before taking the screenshot. Useful for dynamic content that needs time to load or initialize. Default is 0 (no delay). Maximum allowed is 600 seconds.

js_script.description: Optional JavaScript code to execute before taking the screenshot. Useful for dismissing cookie banners, scrolling to specific elements, or manipulating the page state. Example: 'document.getElementById("cookie-banner")?.click();' or 'window.scrollTo(0, 500);'

js_delay_seconds.description: Optional delay in seconds to wait after executing JavaScript before taking the screenshot. Useful for waiting for page changes or animations to complete after JavaScript execution. Default is 0 (no delay). Maximum allowed is 600 seconds.

zoom_level.description: Zoom level for the page before taking screenshot (1.0 = 100%, 0.5 = 50%, 2.0 = 200%). Lower values zoom out to fit more content in viewport. Default is 1.0 (no zoom).
